page.title: 05E.R.N.I.E. (Continued)
page.content:
The {Prize Draws}involve the holders of{Premium Savings Bonds,}a form of National Savings introduced by the Chancellor of the Exchequer ,{ {Mr.Harold McMillan}(now Lord Stockton) in April 1956 and placed on sale on Nov.1st.1956.
By{Oct.1984}there were an estimated{25 {million Bond Holders}holding a total of some{Â£1,671 million pounds}worth of bonds.Over{23.1 million prizes}have been won since 1956 earning a total of {Â£1,268 million}for the lucky Bond Holders. The Prize Fund is formed by calculating one month's interest on each bond in the draw.The{rate of {interest}from November 1984 has been {7 3/4%}per annum.Monthly and weekly draws take place to allot the following prizes:
